summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/09 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Philip Martin'], 'Producers': ['Simon Moseley'], 'Starring': ['Kenneth Branagh', 'Sarah Smart', 'Jeany Spark']} Review Text: Wallender is an interesting, introspective and clever (not to overlook moody) detective who investigates tragic and often gruesome murders. It is well written, well photographed, generally believable and worth watching. You should begin to connect with the character by the third episode. Review Title: Not disappointing Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/10/02 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Kris Greengrove', 'Susan Holden', 'Steve Oakes', 'David Starr', 'Richard Winkler', 'Soo Kim', 'Jennifer Twomey', 'Marcy Pritchard', 'Amy Steinberg', 'Max Goodman'], 'Starring': ['Donovan Patton', 'P.T. Walkley', 'Ethan Kempner'], 'Studio': ['NICKELODEON']} Review Text: Great teaching program. Well done and easy to follow. Review Title: Let your kids watch it... Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/10/24 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Arna Selznick'], 'Producers': ['Jack Chojnacki', 'Lou Gioia', 'Carole MacGillvray', 'Robert Unkel', 'Michael Hirsh', 'Patrick Loubert', 'Clive Smith'], 'Starring': ['Mickey Rooney', 'Georgia Engel'], 'Studio': ['Orion']} Review Text: Good for kids. Review Title: Nice! Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/01/03 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Justin Zackham'], 'Producers': ['Clay Pecorin', 'Harry Ufland', 'Justin Zackham', 'Richard Salvatore', 'Anthony Katagas'], 'Starring': ['Robert De Niro', 'Katherine Heigl', 'Diane Keaton']} Review Text: Very silly and shallow as a puddle. Looked to me like a bunch of actors needed to earn some money so they took a pointless script and plodded along making a movie of it. Occasionally they took a swing at humor but missed by a mile. Makes me wonder if Hollywood has run out of ideas. Save your time. There are far better romantic comedies out there. Review Title: Big Wedding certainly isn't a big success... Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/01/03 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rob Reiner'], 'Producers': ['Rob Reiner', 'Lori McCreary', 'Salli Newman', 'Nicolas Chartier', 'Alan Greisman', 'David Valdes'], 'Starring': ['Morgan Freeman', 'Virginia Madsen'], 'Studio': ['Magnolia Pictures']} Review Text: I expected much more and I think you will also. This is as bland as cream of potato soup. Review Title: No magic here... Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/08/27 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Producers': ['Kris Greengrove', 'Susan Holden', 'Steve Oakes', 'David Starr', 'Richard Winkler', 'Soo Kim', 'Jennifer Twomey', 'Marcy Pritchard', 'Amy Steinberg', 'Max Goodman']} Review Text: Nicely done with good educational messages. Review Title: Learn while you're entertained Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2015/11/22 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ["Darragh O'Connell", 'Timothy Björklund'], 'Producers': ['Kate Boutilier', 'Eryk Casemiro', 'Patricia Resnick', 'Cathal Gaffney', 'Gillian Higgins', 'Karen Ialacci', 'Megan Laughton', 'Diana Manson'], 'Starring': ['Olivia']} Review Text: Pleasant and good for children. A nice message. Review Title: Fun and pleasant... Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/15 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tony Goldwyn'], 'Producers': ['Lynda Obst'], 'Starring': ['Ashley Judd', 'Greg Kinnear', 'Hugh Jackman']} Review Text: A cute movie which goes nowhere and has little (if any) story line whatsoever. A pity as some good talent was wasted here.
It wasn't horrible and might be ok on a rainy afternoon when you have no book to read. Review Title: Not much here... Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/03/30 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joseph L. Mankiewicz'], 'Producers': ['Darryl F. Zanuck'], 'Starring': ['Cary Grant', 'Jeanne Crain', 'Finlay Currie'], 'Studio': ['Fox']} Review Text: This timeless and well-written story is exactly the sort of movie that should be still made today...but sadly isn't. It combines mystery, intrigue, comedy, romance, turns of plot, redemption and optimism. Grant and Crain are exceptional in their roles and Shunderson's put down of Rodney Elwell (Hume Cronyn's character) is hilarious and spot-on. I can't think many people would be disappointed in this one. Review Title: Please watch this one... Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/04/18 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ethan Coen', 'Joel Coen'], 'Producers': ['Mike Lobell', 'Andrew Bergman', 'Ethan Coen', 'Brian Grazer', 'Sean Daniel', 'James Jacks'], 'Starring': ['George Clooney', 'Catherine Zeta-Jones', 'Billy Bob Thornton']} Review Text: wrong. A romantic comedy? Hmm. Very little romance and possibly less comedy. We kept watching this movie certain it would get better...but it didn't. To our shock and dismay it only sank lower into the hole of boredom, stupidity and silliness it began furiously digging at the start. At least they titled it correctly. I can imagine people on a plane from here to Paris with only this movie to watch thinking it was indeed intolerable cruelty. Review Title: Sometimes a movie gets it all... Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Goldfinger Review Date: 2016/06/01 Categories: Suspense, Adventure, Intense, Thrilling Product Description: ['The third installment in the 007 series finds uberspy James Bond (Sean Connery) trying to thwart baddie Auric Goldfinger (Gert Frobe) and his elaborate gambit to corner the gold market by contaminating Fort Knox.'] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Guy Hamilton'], 'Producers': ['Albert R. Broccoli', 'Harry Saltzman'], 'Starring': ['Sean Connery', 'Honor Blackman', 'Gert Frobe']} Review Text: You have to remember how long ago this was released to really appreciate it, and you have to remember James Bond is unquestionably one of the most memorable and enduring of cinema heroes. The stunning film (real film) photography no longer in vogue today and the bright clear colors only film can provide, the special effects (not computer enhanced), the writer's vision of future technology and how it wasn't so far off...so many things to enjoy. The plot? Fundamentally absurd but a fun romp into a scheme that might have worked in 1964. The whole thing was supposed to be fun, actually. I don't know if it was ever meant to be as popular as it has become, but sit down with ice tea and a bowl of popcorn and pretend it isn't 2016. I think you'll be glad you did. Review Title: A lot to enjoy! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/09 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Israel Horovitz'], 'Producers': ['Rachael Horovitz', 'Gary Foster', 'Nitsa Benchetrit', 'David C. Barrot'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Kline', 'Kristin Scott Thomas', 'Maggie Smith'], 'Studio': ['Universal Pictures']} Review Text: There are redeeming moments in this movie, but they're rather few and far between. Overall it is enjoyable and worth watching, but the acting is lukewarm and the plot drags along clumsily at times. All 3 of the main actors are capable of much better work. The supporting actors aren't bad, though. Review Title: Middle of the road... Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/19 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Fred Schepisi'], 'Producers': ['Curtis Burch', 'Gerald Di Pego'], 'Starring': ['Clive Owen', 'Juliette Binoche', 'Bruce Davison'], 'Studio': ['Roadside Attractions']} Review Text: Generally well written, well acted and engaging. In fact this could have been a five star movie. Here is how: (1) downplay the alcoholism a bit as it gets tedious and totally predictable early on (2) include more humor...the funny parts are warm but brief and sporadic (3) move the plot along a little quicker...there are times it drags ahead like a car with four flat tires trying to drive through a mud pit. All in all a good effort, however. Review Title: Mostly very good... Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/27 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Brett Haley'], 'Producers': ['Brett Haley', 'Rebecca Green', 'Laura D. Smith Ireland'], 'Starring': ['Blythe Danner', 'Martin Starr', 'June Squibb'], 'Studio': ['PREFERRED CONTENT']} Review Text: It is always sad to see decent actors/actresses make a terrible movie just to get a payday, but in this case I'm afraid that's what happened. The plot is totally without imagination, there are only a few humorous parts, the overall effect is one of boredom coupled with nearly complete lack of passion and emotion. The solitary good point is there isn't anything offensive about it. Of course, if you read what I've written, you already know there isn't much about it at all. Save your time. There are much better alternatives. Review Title: Save your time, please... Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/07/15 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Gower Champion'], 'Producers': ['Gant Gaither', 'Doane Harrison'], 'Starring': ['Debbie Reynolds', 'Cliff Robertson', 'David Janssen']} Review Text: Oh my goodness...a movie which went absolutely nowhere. We kept waiting for it to, but it never did. Please watch something else Debbie Reynolds did. There are plenty of choices and this isn't one of them. Sorry but there isn't anything positive to say about this one at all. Review Title: Went nowhere, said nothing, no humor, etc, etc... Rating: 1.0 --------------------------------------------------

Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The analyzed purchase history reveals a person who displays a strong preference for quality storytelling, valuing engaging plots and character development. Consistently high ratings, particularly for educational content and thoughtful narratives, indicate a pursuit of meaningful viewing experiences, as observed in the favorable reviews for children’s programming and classic films. The individual appears inclined toward content that offers depth—seen in positive remarks about well-written and introspective detective stories—while expressing dissatisfaction with shallow or predictable storylines, evident through low ratings for uninspired romantic comedies and poorly executed films.

Price sensitivity seems minimal, as high-quality content takes precedence over cost; the person seems to appreciate what they perceive as value-for-money concerning educational benefits and entertainment quality. While favoring genres like mystery, adventure, and children’s programming, they also exhibit a critical lens when assessing production quality, writing, and performance, contributing to their ratings' variability. Overall, this person's core preferences center on enriching, character-driven stories that educate or provoke thought while dismissing content lacking substance or creativity.

target_interaction.title: Not the best role model...
target_interaction.text: Honestly the show quality is fine but I find the whole premise of the Pokemon thing a bit odd.  I don't think it sets a good example for behavior at all.  I know...it is popular but so are a lot of other things I think are not appropriate.
